Concepts.definition: the concept that the universe is a holographic projection
a method for personal growth and development through heightened consciousness
a state where an individual's consciousness separates from their physical body

Techniques or Procedures.description: a method for inducing a state of heightened attentiveness and relaxation through sound frequencies
a visualization technique for enhancing bodily energy flow and protecting against lower-energy entities
an advanced technique for identifying problems, filling expanded awareness with perceptions of those problems, and projecting them out into the universe to enlist the assistance of one's higher self

Scientific Facts.fact: brain hemisphere synchronization is necessary for inducing an OBE
REM sleep is a state where most people experience OBEs

Numerical Data.context: associated with brain hemisphere synchronization and OBE induction
associated with an experiment where individuals attempted to read computer-generated numbers in the OBE state

Definitions.definition: a three-dimensional image created by a holographic process
rapid eye movement, a stage of sleep characterized by rapid eye movements and increased brain activity

Verifiable Claims or Statements.claim: the Gateway Program can develop human consciousness and interact with dimensions beyond physical reality

Verifiable Claims or Statements.statement: most people experience OBEs during REM sleep

Gateway Technique.Definition: A method for personal growth and self-discovery

Types of Magic Users.Mages: learned magic through study and practice

Magic-Driven Empires.Statement: Powerful magical dynasties have risen and fallen

Magical Artefacts.Statement: Ancient relics imbued with powerful magic have been used as tools of war, diplomacy, or symbols of authority

Using Magic.Meditation: a method for connecting with and feeling magic

Using Magic.Artifact Use: using magical items to enhance abilities

Learning Magic.Practice: regular practice allows magic users to refine their skills

Learning Magic.Study and Research: delving into ancient texts, seeking mentors, or experimenting with new techniques can help magic users expand their knowledge and capabilities

Learning Magic.Mentorship: working under the guidance of experienced magic users

Meditation.description: A practice of quiet reflection, often used to achieve a state of calm and inner peace

Prayer.description: The act of communicating with a higher power; seeking guidance, comfort, or assistance

Mage Classes.Name: High Mage
Mage Classes.Description: The highest level of magic mastery

Mage Classes.Name: Silver Mage
Mage Classes.Description: Above gold mage in skill and ability

Mage Classes.Name: Divine Mage
Mage Classes.Description: At the highest point of magic mastery

Concepts.Name: Origo
Concepts.Description: The most pure form of magic

Concepts.Name: Magic Building
Concepts.Description: A framework for spellcasting and magical energy manipulation

Wind Magic.Name: Wind singer
Wind Magic.Description: Can listen and translate the wind

Water Magic.Name: Wet cloak
Water Magic.Description: Able to become one with water

Animal Control.Name: Whisperer
Animal Control.Description: Can speak with animals, strong ones can control animals

Animal Control.Name: Leavoy
Animal Control.Description: Can make flora do his bidding

Plant Creation.Name: Witch
Plant Creation.Description: Makes potions and some can use enchanter on themselves

Shadow Magic.Name: Shadow walker
Shadow Magic.Description: Able to use the shadow and become one with it

Shadow Magic.Name: Shadow master
Shadow Magic.Description: Able to use the shadow and manipulate shadow

Other.Name: Glitch
Other.Description: Mastering shadow walking as mastering manipulating shadow

conditions for casting, casting times, etc.
ability that allows a character to cast a spell
items used in spells, such as weapons or potions

maintaining balance and order in the universe

definitions.definition: defines the rules and mechanics behind spell casting
manipulate the fabric of reality itself to maintain balance and order in the universe

Consequences of Chaos.statement: Chaos can lead to destruction and disorder

Order Sequence.name: Hierarchy
Order Sequence.description: A system where authority is held by a single individual or group

Order Sequence.name: Bureaucracy
Order Sequence.description: A complex system of administration characterized by a large number of officials and rules

Chaos Sequence.name: Anarchy
Chaos Sequence.description: A state of society without government or law

Chaos Sequence.name: Revolution
Chaos Sequence.description: A violent overthrow of an existing government or social order
